traceability.evidence: The Vitest suite (npm test) shows: ✓ prompts/007.0-DEV-SEPARATE-PROD-DEV-THRESHOLDS: Supports separate prod/dev threshold flags and config All 142 tests pass, including the functional end-to-end test for story 007.0. Code inspection confirms: • CLI flags --prod-min-age, --dev-min-age, --prod-severity, --dev-severity are parsed in src/cli-options.js and src/cli-options-helpers.js. • Config file support for { prod: { minAge, minSeverity }, dev: { minAge, minSeverity } } in src/config-loader.js. • Dependency type (prod vs dev) detection via loadPackageJson() and getDependencyType in src/print-outdated.js. • Fallback to general --min-age/--severity when prod/dev flags are absent, and backward-compatible defaults. • Output includes a “Type” column showing ‘prod’ or ‘dev’ in src/print-outdated-handlers.js.
traceability.notes: All acceptance criteria for story 007.0 (separate prod/dev thresholds) have been implemented and verified by both unit and functional tests.
